intro: Lloydia serotina f. parva, commonly known as the dwarf lloydia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Crassulaceae. It is a perennial herb characterized by its compact growth habit and fleshy, succulent leaves. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It is native to the southeastern United States, particularly in areas with moist, sandy soils. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is often cultivated in gardens and rockeries.
